labyrinth

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • labyrinth.GameObject
      • labyrinth.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Movable

    public class Player
extends GameObject
implements Movable
    Class that represents a player of the labyrinth. Player needs to have a Keys to exit a labyrinth. When player meets a Monster he dies and loses his keys.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(Position pos, MovableObserver observer)
      To construct player you need to specify it's position an observer, that looks if player has moved.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      Position calcNewPosition(Direction dir)
      Calculate new position of the object, if it would move in given position.
      void dropKey()
      After this method been called player has no Keys anymore.

      Character to use when drawing object on the terminal.

      Color to use when drawing this object.

      void pickUpKey()

      • Player

        public Player(Position pos,
      MovableObserver observer)
        To construct player you need to specify it's position an observer, that looks if player has moved.
        Parameters:
        pos - initial position of player.
        observer - class that is called when player wants to move.
